alert.note: Alert for McHenry (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 11:22AM CDT until further notice by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Bismarck ND has issued a Flood Warning for the Souris River near Towner affecting McHenry County in North Dakota... ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Souris River near Towner. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 1456.0 feet, Moderate flood stage. Flood problems begin with agricultural land and meadows affected. At 1456.2 feet, Secondary roads become covered with water. Farmers on the right side of the river looking downstream will be affected but little damage. Water bypasses gage at this height. At 1456.7 feet, Widespread flooding west and north of town with many roads affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 1454.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 1456.6 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 1454.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 1456.6 feet on 04/03/1987. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
